channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Egregious Haitian-Immigration Decision
item.description: A federal judge’s ruling blocking President Trump from ending Haiti’s protected status doesn’t pass the smell test.

item.title: Nike faces federal probe over allegations of 'DEI-related' discrimination against white workers
item.description: The federal agency for protecting workers' civil rights revealed Wednesday that it is investigating sportswear giant Nike for allegedly discriminating...

item.title: Republican who said Sen Cassidy ‘sucks’ gets Trump endorsement after ditching Senate bid for House run
item.description: President Trump has endorsed state Sen. Blake Miguez who is running for U.S. House of Representatives after dropping a Senate bid in Louisiana.

item.title: Chinese national who exposed rights abuses is freed from U.S. detention after being granted asylum
item.description: Guan Heng, a Chinese national who exposed human rights abuses in his homeland, has been released from federal detention more than five months after be...

item.title: 11 Democrats running to keep blue-leaning seat in party hands as GOP House majority on the brink
item.description: Eleven Democrats compete in New Jersey's 11th District primary Thursday, with the winner facing Republican Joe Hathaway in April's special election.

item.title: In the Glass Hive of Art News: Dark Clouds at the Met, Boston’s MFA
item.description: New directors, federal arts money keeps flowing, and a young lion finds a new home.

item.title: The 2026 private equity outlook appears hazy, says PitchBook
item.description: PitchBook data shows private equity exit value surged, even as fundraising struggled.

item.title: Less than 10% of employees believe their bosses are demonstrating moral leadership
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Overreliance on Renewables Leaves Americans Out in the Cold
item.description: Americans are at greater risk of power outages when we rely too much on wind, solar, and battery storage systems.

item.title: The ‘dumb money’ steps in as traders lose $1 trillion on the realization that AI will eat tech companies first
item.description: The chaos is mostly a tech-stock phenomenon. The equal-weight S&P 500 is actually at a record high.

item.title: Trump returns to National Prayer Breakfast as faith takes center stage in second term
item.description: President Donald Trump returns to the National Prayer Breakfast after pledging to protect Christians and form a Justice Department task force to comba...

item.title: Starmer’s Pathetic China Debut Is A Lesson For All Western Leaders
item.description: Europe must learn that Xi Jinping only plays nice when faced with resolute strength, not bowing and scraping.

item.title: Purdue Hiring 1,000 Foreigners In 5 Years Illustrates Higher Ed’s H-1B Problem
item.description: The H-1B program has turned into a privileged hiring initiative for universities, with 16,000 such visas issued for the last two semesters.

item.title: Pro-life group finds Biden-era FDA policy is driving 500 abortions per day, says Trump has power to end it
item.description: Mail-order abortion pills now account for one in four U.S. abortions after the Biden administration removed doctor visit requirements, a new report sh...

item.title: Developer Hongkong Land launches a $6.5B Singapore real estate fund, the country’s largest, as part of CEO Michael Smith’s strategic pivot
item.description: The new fund has the Qatar Investment Authority as a key investor, as Hongkong Land focuses on commercial property and slims its residential business.

item.title: This Gen Z woman applied for 1,000 jobs and offered to cut her own pay because she was ‘really broke and struggling.’ She’s not alone
item.description: Taking a pay cut at the beginning of your career can have long-term consequences.

item.title: GOP firebrand urges Trump agencies to claw back massive taxpayer benefits paid out to immigrants
item.description: Sen. Jim Banks is urging key Trump administration agencies to recoup what he believes could be billions in benefits paid out to immigrants on the Amer...

item.title: The Government Food Pyramid Is All Junk
item.description: It’s the height of arrogance for bureaucrats to tell us what to eat.

item.title: Trump Stops Tax Dollars From Funding Transgender Ideology In Other Countries
item.description: The State Department is ensuring that taxpayer dollars don’t fund trans ideology thinly disguised as 'global humanitarian assistance.'

item.title: Where Ice and ICE Meet
item.description: On the south side of Minneapolis, getting rid of the ice has a different meaning.

item.title: Democrats reveal 10-point list of demands for ICE reforms
item.description: Democratic leaders laid out their terms for continuing to fund Homeland Security on Wednesday, saying the department must severely curb its immigratio...

item.description: Trump administration officials traveled to Los Angeles on Wednesday to outline the president's plan to override state and local rules and speed up the...

item.title: Europeans Testify On How Europe Is Banning Americans From Saying What They Believe
item.description: 'European laws [are] now being exported by the European Union. ... American speech is already being affected.'
